noun.description: The measurement from base to top or (of a standing person) from head to foot.
examples: columns rising to 65 feet in height
both men were of average height

noun.description: The most intense part or period of something.
examples: the height of the tourist season
they took consumerism to new heights
at the height of his career

origin: Old English hēhthu (in the sense top of something), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hoogte, also to high.
